Welcome to kickMail’s documentation!¶

Contents:

kickMail.py - Automate Kickstarter backer lists.

Features¶

  • Input is the csv file as exported from Kickstarter
  • Program provides input field flexibility to allow for some column moving (Kickstarter changes this from time to time).
  • Output is a USPS formated CSV file which can be directly imported into the USPS as an Address Book.

Input File¶

How to export the file from Kickstarter

  • Kickstarter
  • Menu (on)
  • Backer Report
  • Export
  • All Reward Tiers
  • Save to ZIP
  • Extract/combine into one CSV file (only one header line)

Code¶

class kickMail.FindCSVFile¶

Find the CSV input file.

findCSVFileBrowse(startingPath)¶
Parameters:startingPath – start browsing from this folder.
Returns:path/file name of the file that was selected

findCSVFileBrowse() - Dialog which locates the csv files using the file browser.

class kickMail.ControlClass¶
countBoards(theInList)¶

Count the boards and generate a snapshot of the data.

  • 4 - Shipping Amount, $5.00 USD
  • 5 - Reward Minimum,
  • 6 - Pledge Amount,
Parameters:theInList – The entire list
Returns:no value
mapInputList(theInList)¶

Map the column headers to an internal preferred ordering. Latest input format -

  • Backer Number,
  • Backer UID,
  • Backer Name,
  • Email,
  • Shipping Country,
  • Shipping Amount,
  • Reward Minimum,
  • Pledge Amount,
  • Pledged At,
  • Rewards Sent?,
  • Pledged Status,
  • Notes,
  • Survey Response,
  • Shipping Name,
  • Shipping Address 1,
  • Shipping Address 2,
  • Shipping City,
  • Shipping State,
  • Shipping Postal Code,
  • Shipping Country Name,
  • Shipping Country Code
Parameters:theInList – The entire input list.
Returns:a mapping file with the columns mapped to a column number.
readInCSV(inFile)¶
Parameters:inFile – The pointer to the CSV file that gets read in.
Returns:the CSV file as a list.

Read the input CSV file into a list.

theExecutive()¶

The code that calls the other code

writeOutUSPSAddressBook(outFilePtr, theList)¶

Write out the USPS Address book values. The output file is a CSV that can be read by the USPS Address Book Import.

Output list -

  • 0 - First Name,
  • 1 - MI,
  • 2 - Last Name,
  • 3 - Company,
  • 4 - Address 1,
  • 5 - Address 2,
  • 6 - Address 3,
  • 7 - City,
  • 8 - State/Province,
  • 9 - ZIP/Postal Code,
  • 10 - Country,
  • 11 - Urbanization (relates to Puerto Rico)
  • 12 - Phone Number,
  • 13 - Fax Number,
  • 14 - E Mail,
  • 15 - Reference Number,
  • 16 - Nickname,,,
Parameters:outFilePtr – points to the output file
Returns:no return value
